Raw material: TrIrSi (Tr = Y, Ti, Zr, and Hf)
Sentence: In the previous report, ternary iridium silicides TrIrSi (Tr = Y, Ti, Zr, and Hf) are reported as superconductors with T c = 2.70 K (Y), 2.04 K (Zr), and 3.50 K (Hf) with the o-TrTr X Â¢ structure .
The H 0 c2 m (0) values of TrIrSi are somewhat smaller than those of P, As-TrTr X Â¢ compounds (T c = 13 K, H 0 c2 m = 17.5 T), which is similar to the silicide- TrTr X Â¢ compound ZrRuSi [6].
The T c of o-MoRuP is 15.5 K and N E F ( ) is calculated to be 1.38 states/(eV f.u.) , which is smaller than that of HfIrSi (1.79 states/(eV f.u.) with T c = 3.4 K.
T c of ZrIrSi is slightly lower than that of the previous report (2.04 K).

We discover a new superconductor, TiIrSi at T c = 1.4 K, and reveal a superconducting state of TrIrSi (Tr = Ti, Zr, and Hf) by using dc magnetic susceptibility T ( ) c , electrical resistivity T ( ) r , and specific heat C(T) measurements.
In a previous study, ZrRuSi prepared by the arc-melting method did not exhibit superconductivity above 1.2 K [3].
